block.p: ALEXION PHARMACEUTICALS INC., New Haven, a biopharmaceutical company, bought the closely held Prolifaron Inc., San Diego, for $41 million in stock to speed development of its antibody drugs.
ALEXION PHARMACEUTICALS INC., New Haven, a biopharmaceutical company, bought the closely held Prolifaron Inc., San Diego, for $41 million in stock to speed development of its antibody drugs.

STEWART ENTERPRISES INC., Metairie, La., an owner of funeral homes and cemeteries, said it was in talks with Funespana S.A., a Spanish funeral services company, to sell its European operations. Terms were not disclosed.
CINERGY CORP., Cincinnati, a gas and electric utility holding company, said it would spend more than $700 million on pollution control equipment to reduce nitrogen oxide emissions, which cause smog.

GLOBALSTAR TELECOMMUNICATIONS LTD., New York, a satellite telecommunications company, said five of its founding partners would provide it with further equity financing of $56 million. The partners are Loral Space and Communications Ltd., Vodafone Group P.L.C., Qualcomm Inc., Elsacom, and a France Telecom/Alcatel partnership.
